definitions.text: the thick white fluid containing spermatozoa that is ejaculated by the male genital tract
move toward, travel toward something or somebody or approach something or somebody
examples: He came singing down the road
Come with me to the Casbah
come down here!
come out of the closet!
come into the room

definitions.text: reach a destination; arrive by movement or progress
examples: She arrived home at 7 o'clock
She didn't get to Chicago until after midnight

definitions.text: come to pass; arrive, as in due course
examples: The first success came three days later
It came as a shock
Dawn comes early in June

definitions.text: reach or enter a state, relation, condition, use, or position
examples: The water came to a boil
We came to understand the true meaning of life
Their anger came to a boil
I came to realize the true meaning of life
The shoes came untied
come into contact with a terrorist group
his face went red
your wish will come true

definitions.text: to be the product or result
examples: Melons come from a vine
Understanding comes from experience

definitions.text: be found or available
examples: These shoes come in three colors; The furniture comes unassembled

definitions.text: come forth
examples: A scream came from the woman's mouth
His breath came hard

definitions.text: be a native of
examples: She hails from Kalamazoo

definitions.text: extend or reach
examples: The water came up to my waist
The sleeves come to your knuckles

definitions.text: exist or occur in a certain point in a series
examples: Next came the student from France

definitions.text: cover a certain distance
examples: She came a long way

definitions.text: come under, be classified or included
examples: fall into a category
This comes under a new heading

definitions.text: happen as a result
examples: Nothing good will come of this

definitions.text: add up in number or quantity
examples: The bills amounted to $2,000
The bill came to $2,000

definitions.text: develop into
examples: This idea will never amount to anything
nothing came of his grandiose plans

definitions.text: be received
examples: News came in of the massacre in Rwanda

definitions.text: come to one's mind; suggest itself
examples: It occurred to me that we should hire another secretary
A great idea then came to her

definitions.text: come from; be connected by a relationship of blood, for example
examples: She was descended from an old Italian noble family
he comes from humble origins

definitions.text: proceed or get along
examples: How is she doing in her new job?
How are you making out in graduate school?
He's come a long way

definitions.text: experience orgasm
examples: she could not come because she was too upset

definitions.text: have a certain priority
examples: My family comes first
